alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 6:47PM MST until July 28 at 9:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 945 PM MST. * At 646 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wupatki National Monument, Wupatki Visitors Center and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 435 and 449. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Citadel Wash, Jackrabbit Wash, Ball Court Wash, Deadman Wash, Doney Mountain Wash, Campbell Francis Wash, Kanaa Wash, Hulls Wash and Cedar Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
